website_summaries.verdict: Slightly less pricey than some other 12-ton hydraulic shop presses, plus it has a sturdy construction that will last a long time.
pros: Excellent build quality that will give you plenty of value over time
Steel frame remains sturdy while you're working
High-quality paint job resists rusting and is easy to clean
Uses an H-frame and sturdy legs to prevent wobble
cons: Costs more than others with similar power levels
Not made for those who need constant, heavy-duty performance

customer_reviews.title: Poor press, very weak
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Good for very light pressing. 12 ton is a joke, more than 1ton will bend this thing up. Press is very wobbly and won’t press straight down, but pushes off at an angle. Had to weld top corners to get any rigidity, and then was still to weak to press bearings on an axle. Bent the support cross bar pushing bearings on.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lindell

customer_reviews.title: Great press
customer_reviews.text: Awesome press. Took all of 20 min to assimble. Make sure you lay everything out on the ground as shown in picture and assimble from there I started at the base and worked my way up. 11/16 bolts on bottom 3/4 bolts on top once you hang the jack tray tighten hooks almost all the way place jack on the beam in the center. Lift up and tighten hooks rest of the way and that should hold jack in place.
customer_reviews.author: Roach

customer_reviews.title: It’s from China and need not say anymore.
customer_reviews.text: It’s cheap alright . Very thin metal .and the box came soaking wet and torn up. Very surprised all the parts were in there. I think it will work for most smaller bearings . If your in a bind it should work but not a everyday press. When bolted together it was not very square . Had to do some modifications to it and the handle . I think I will weld all the corners and weld the handle together and beef it up a little and make it more sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Jim markevich

customer_reviews.title: Quality seems good but missing angle iron, springs & bolts!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was initially impressed with the thick red angle iron & beams sent to make up the frame but quickly noticed my package was missing one of the angle iron feet. No problem, I went out to the shed and cut a scrap piece I had to make up for the missing piece. After putting together more of the frame I notice I'm missing the bolts for the top support. No problem, I have spare bolts. I get to looking a little closer and see I'm also missing the springs! At this point I give up! Now I have to pack this thing back up and deal with sending it back... Should have just bought locally on this item!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good press for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first, serious hydraulic press, and I can't be more happier with this purchase. It does everything that I could ask of it. I initially purchased this unit to handle some Toyota (front) bearings that are a bear to remove - you cannot hammer those out. This press handled that job with very little fuss. The price is great; sure, it's not Made in USA, but for this price, it's gotta be a best bang-for-the-buck winner. The tolerances are not the greatest - we're not doing precision work here, and at this price-point, you can't complain... The powdercoating is pretty thick and durable, so the finish should last quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: f8ldzz

customer_reviews.title: Directions were of marginal use but it's a pretty simple machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a bench-top model. Much smaller that I thought it would be, but that's more my fault fit not reading enough before clicking buy. Cheap Chinese cardboard box failed during shipping but UPS taped it up and everything was still in there when I opened it up. Assembly was simple. Directions were of marginal use but it's a pretty simple machine. Plain-Jane two-stage hydraulic bottle jack pushing a spring loaded base into a crossbarthat is sitting on two pins Did come with a pair of press plates but nothing else. Makes me really miss my dad's Van Norman press.
customer_reviews.author: StoneCoast

customer_reviews.title: cheap press for small projects
customer_reviews.text: this press is adequate for small projects. It's not the sturdiest press out there but for the price its good. the only thing that i didn't like about it was the fact that there is a lot of play in the press bar and it will wiggle left and right as it situates itself on the object you're pressing. this can sometimes cause an incorrect amount of pressure on the side of the object you're working on. just get a piece of wood and jam it between the press bar and the side of the press to keep it from wiggling.
customer_reviews.author: TeeGeeOh

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The jack stand is not built to withstand the pressure applied by the hydraulic press. Garbage. Used less than 5 times and it is already tweaked and bent up to the point that it is unusable. The main braces themselves bent. When I attempted to return the press, my request was denied. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and bends
customer_reviews.text: Had item for roughy 3 months ram is already leaking fluid and will not hold pressure, I am not using for big projects. Sad that it’s nit holding up, also within the first 2 weeks the metal support in the middle began bending, I mean it should be able to handle maximum pressure, right? And I don’t think I was even using full pressure to be honest. It was good while it lasted I guess
customer_reviews.author: Emma & Alec

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: The press in the picture has a two tube guides, but the actual one does not have these guides. Instead, it uses the bottom plate which rides inside the frame as the guide. However, there is a big gap which causes a lot of side to side movement. I guess a wood shim could be used to fill the gap and keep it straight. You get what you pay for. Great for DIY.
customer_reviews.author: Kona-Sean

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This press is what I was looking for. A press I could use in my shop at home, that wouldn't break the bank and wouldn't take up alot of space. That is exactly what this is. This is not a professional grade press, however for the price, I wouldn't expect it to be. I used it to put a wheel bearing in a 2003 escape knuckle, the bearing was seized in the knuckle, yet I was still able to do the job and press performed well.
customer_reviews.author: TMCLEN

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: Got ujoints in my c3 half shafts in like a champ. Can't wait to try to make silver rings with dies out of coins with it too.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Galt

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Paid for itself first use lol. Shipping this thing would cost me more than the price shipped. Value value value.
customer_reviews.author: Aron K

customer_reviews.title: Great Press for the Price
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered was damaged in delivery, weighing almost 100lbs it's not hard to imagine why. I just ordered another one and it made it ok. Besides issues with delivery the press itself is working great and exactly what I imagined it would be. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S. Chenot

customer_reviews.title: bad company to buy from
customer_reviews.text: Had to order this product twice. First package arrive tattered and torn with to many parts missing to assemble. Second order arrived with no hardware, went to Ace Hardware and bought what I needed. Darn sure won't buy this brand name again...........To much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: hkb2506

customer_reviews.title: I would give five stars its well made for the ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give five stars its well made for the money. But it was sheer luck it was all in the box when it was delivered by ups, the box was split open and parts were on the ground the hardware bag was ripped 3 nuts were missing they are metric, I have a metric nut and bolts bin so I was able to replace what was missing without getting new bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not for professional use or car enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.text: This press can not accommodate a steering knuckle, no mater how hard you try. It shifts around and there is no included hardware besides the press plates must be bolted down to a bench because once it's assembled it acts like a cheap bar stool. MUCH SMALLER THAN I EXPECTED. on the ground its too short and on a table its too tall and your project is exactly eye level (I'm 5'9") not safe. All of the bad reviews you read are also true.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney D. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: not the same as the one pictured.
customer_reviews.text: this picture is wrong. its not the same press. the press still works for what i need it for, but its not as good as something that is shown in the pic. The one in the picture has guides and a more robust frame. I'm disappointed, but it would cost the same amount for me to return it as it did for what i paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: gnick

customer_reviews.title: 12 tons
customer_reviews.text: Has to be best tool in the shop. I hope the guys let me use it.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: DIYer
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. 1st use was pressing bearings on new differential.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce J

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: we had to return this product do to the fact it didn't work when we got it.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: GR8 product for the $$
customer_reviews.text: went together without a hitch by leaving things finger tight until all the bolts were in place nicely painted, works well too GR8 value for the part timer
customer_reviews.author: Flavio

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Was missing a piece and bent when trying to press a bearing for a corolla. If you are buying for this purpose either get a bigger one, or just skip the press and buy a wheel bearing adapter kit for about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Box destroyed
customer_reviews.text: This product was so mangled in the box there is a part that isn’t dented. U pay 200 bucks for a product and the box’s is destroyed hardware missing this is rediculous
customer_reviews.author: Bill Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The box the press came in was a mess. Product ok except for missing all the hardware to assemble. Delivery time and product impressed good quality
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly and is easy to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install wheel studs and replace u-joints. It works perfectly and is easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: very good deal
customer_reviews.text: Very good small press. I purchased this press to press wheel bearings and ball joints. I also use it to shape sheet meatal.
customer_reviews.author: Lakeside Resident Care Llc

customer_reviews.title: Only got half the product.
customer_reviews.text: Only got half the product. No hardware, only one spring, no press plates or the slide pins for adjusting the level. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: cheaper then the store and a great press
customer_reviews.text: Great press, easy to put together. I use it on all the time in automatic work.
customer_reviews.author: Tomarcia Wilson

customer_reviews.title: it's great it's done everything that I wanted it
customer_reviews.text: it's great it's done everything that I wanted it to
customer_reviews.author: Norman S.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I did was press it until the lower bar yielded. Nothing else broke though- the welds all held and the support pins didn't gouge or deform. It's a bit sloppy in fit but it works. It comes with a couple fitting blocks as well. Free shipping makes it a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: excellent small cheap shop press
customer_reviews.text: bolted together and sits flat. excellent small cheap shop press. i use mine for rebuilding manual transmissions and it works fairly well. some light modifications to keep the press centred.
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit.
customer_reviews.text: I would buy the Harbor Freight one before this one. I bought this one because I had some Amazon gift cards. The fit and finish on this one is sloppy. There is a lot of play in cross piece that the ram sits on, which is something you don't want in a press. I would not recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Georgeson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: What I got was not what was the press in the picture and it was missing parts.......
customer_reviews.author: Jason K.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap china junk
customer_reviews.text: Weak, flimsy, coudnt press a wheel bearing out of a hub without buckling the photo isnt accurate its a totally different smaller press. and a waist of time and definatly a waist of money do not buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: harbor freight is a way better deal
customer_reviews.text: Harbor frieght is way cheaorr for a thicker steel. Plus this came missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy S

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be an effective press
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift to our son and he did a job replacing bearings on his truck. He ws happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Emmet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Product for pressing out Hub Bearings on Saturn SC2 SL2 and Honda EG Civic
customer_reviews.author: David Tabing

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: came without press plates.Had to spend another 55 bucks on those just to make it work
customer_reviews.author: Angie Vogler

customer_reviews.title: Definetly made in China the bottom cross bar holes did ...
customer_reviews.text: Definetly made in China the bottom cross bar holes did not line up and had to drill my own holes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Press
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a great 12 ton press. I would like to buy replacement parts, notably the push rod and arm, they always get bent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: It tucks away nicely when not being used and has the power to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a small shop press that can handle the work of the handing man or backyard mechanic. It tucks away nicely when not being used and has the power to handle all of the jobs that I have given it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, soft metal, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: packagine was damaged on arrival. Not what was picture, though similar. shorter then I thought it would be. biggest problem the press shaft bent to the side the first time I tried to press an axle out of a wheel bearing. and side of the resting beam bent. arbor plates a bit soft as well edges round over very easily and no longer provide a straight edge to rest small lipped items on to press out bushings. Thankfully Amazon refunded my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Whittle

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Missing two springs, but sold as refurbished so was not disappointed as these were easy to acquire. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: G. Loveday

customer_reviews.title: ... assemble it and no return springs item is totally useless
customer_reviews.text: no hardware to assemble it and no return springs item is totally useless
customer_reviews.author: kelly nunn

customer_reviews.title: does all it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: This press works great. Was able to press out all the bushings on the front end of my project car with ease. project set up is fairly ease. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: gregg wilroy

customer_reviews.title: It's already paid for itself
customer_reviews.text: The box was thrashed! Luckily nothing fell out. For the price I got exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISEMENT
customer_reviews.text: I ordered The Torin T51201 shop press-12 Ton as shown in this picture but the one I received is not the same as shown in this picture. I am very dissapointed in the false advertisement. The box the press came in, was destroyed by the rain so I cannot return it to the seller. I would like to return this press for the one shown in the picture.The press you sent me is a piece of crap and I would like to exchange this press as soon as possible.
customer_reviews.author: venode shiwlochan

customer_reviews.title: Needs modification to assemble, drifts side to side, overall good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I had to file several holes wider in order to be able to make up the bolts. It is fine for small tasks in a home garage.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Torin 12T Press
customer_reviews.text: Worked really good. Can't beat it for the price. Used it to replace the U joints on a one ton truck and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: As long as you don't need more, it works
customer_reviews.text: An auto repair forum said get a 12 ton press, save lots of money. Very true. But then in the comments some commenters said get a 20 ton. They were right, this has its limits. So, first, make sure 12 tons is enough and if it is, get this.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete item Shipped
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item and when opened I did not find the 12 ton jack,1 spring and the nuts and bolts. What do amazon expect me to do with this item which I purchased for $153.00?
customer_reviews.author: Gittens Henry

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Putting a 12 ton jack on 2 ton rated steel does not make a 12 ton press. What a worthless piece of pot metal. The press buckled and bent with its first use last night and didn't get the job done. I am hoping I can return it, I will update.
customer_reviews.author: tom

product_meta.title: BIG RED T51201 Torin Steel H-Frame Hydraulic Garage/Shop Floor Press with Stamping Plates, 12 Ton (24,000 lb) Capacity, Red
product_meta.description: The Torin BIG RED T51201 heavy-duty steel H-frame hydraulic garage/shop floor press is designed for straightening, bending, pressing, and stamping. Equipped with a 12 ton (24,000 lb) capacity bottle jack with a working range from 10-1/2" to 35". Manually raise and lower the table surface for the best working distance for the job. Includes arbor press stamping plates that feature V-blocks and a 180-degree guide design. Features high quality precision springs for slowly and safely bouncing back after pressing down operation. The piston-ram is treated and polished to resist skiving. After a thorough chemical wash to ensure a long-lasting finish and to help prevent rust, it's treated with a powder-coated, lead-free paint, providing a durable coating which is oil, grease, and dirt-resistant for easy cleanup. Meets ASME PASE safety standards and includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: Heavy-duty steel H-frame hydraulic garage/shop floor press is designed for straightening, bending, pressing, and stamping; Includes arbor press stamping plates that feature V-blocks and a 180-degree guide design
Manually raise and lower the table surface for the best working distance for the job; Equipped with a 12 ton (24,000 lb) capacity bottle jack with a working range from 10-1/2" to 35"
Features high quality precision springs for slowly and safely bouncing back after pressing down operation; Piston-ram is treated and polished to resist skiving
Treated with a powder-coated, lead-free paint, providing a durable coating which is oil, grease, and dirt-resistant for easy cleanup
Meets ASME PASE safety standards and includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty
